results.title: The Days of Whiskey Gap
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Roman Kroitor, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The 1870s were years of grave crises in the Canadian West. American whiskey traders were victimizing the Indians. Chief Sitting Bull and his Sioux warriors, fresh from their victory over the US Cavalry, were camped near the Cypress Hills, and the stage was set for tragedy. In 1873, the North-West Mounted Police were established to maintain law and order in the newly acquired North-West Territories. The following summer a courageous expedition trekked 800 miles from Fort Dufferin, south of Winnipeg, to Fort Whoopup, near present-day Lethbridge. The force raised the flag and proclaimed the Queen’s law, ensuring that the Canadian West would not become a lawless American-style frontier. This film brings to life some of the legends of the men in the scarlet tunics.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Low, Roman Kroitor, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Seventh mandarin
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow, Xerox Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Desire to read”.
Long ago in a walled palace lived a Chiense emperor, guarded and guided by seven assistants called mandarins. None of them ever set foot outside the palace and they knew nothing of the people until the seventh and youngest mandarin ventured out one night…Based on the picture book by Jane Yolen.

results.title: Pride and diversity
results.brief_description: ‘Pride and Diversity’ was a program of digital storytelling workshops with multiple groups focussed on community issues and cultural diversity. In partnership with VicHealth, City of Stonington, City of Melbourne, Kensington Association, Kensington Women’s Dinner, Kensington Storytelling Festival ‘ community storytellers, Quiksound Productions- City of Monash FReeZA committee, Minus 18, Inside Out Group, Pride & Diversity group- Monash Youth & Family Services, Roleplay, Soundslike ‘ City of Stonington’s FreeZA committee, Go Girl Go, Young Mum’s program, The Club, Girls Own - YWCA
